channel.title: More organized gold status
channel.description: It should be morr organized on buying gold status for ur server. Ive been wanting to buy this for a long time but dont really see a way to do that. Thanks hope someone reads this and does sumtin about it

item.title: More organized gold status
item.dc:creator: @12igon8 12igon8
item.description:
@12igon8 wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:12, topic:385378”][quote author=hadesflames link=topic=481132.msg3524867#msg3524867 date=1299717628]
No offense, but if you’re actually making money, or have money to spend on your server you shouldn’t be on a free host. Don’t get me wrong, SMF New is great, matter of fact I used to work with the owner of SMF New on Dream Portal, but honestly, the first thing I did on my server before even releasing it is to get a proper domain for it.

You also seem to have quite a bit of spam on it. Unless you’ve moved to a different site, in which case you should update your siggy =p
[/quote]I own Uncalled Attack [one of the most popular servers there is] making $35-$250 a day and am still on a free domain, just because there’s nothing wrong with the domain I have now. I’m planning on getting a VBulletin and a payed domain though.[/quote]

Never heard of it
:tollol:

Read full topic

item.title: More organized gold status
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

I think it’s a dumb idea to be honest. All it will do is make it more expensive for the bidders (which I guess is good for mopar). After the last auto extend, it will once again be based on who gets a bid in at the very last second. SAME Problem, more money needed to spend. What REALLY needs to be done is to not allow bidding until the last two days. Make it a Friday and Saturday BEFORE the 10th of the month. Otherwise, people bid early, which does nothing but jack up the prices, and they don’t win anyway. Did anyone SEE the prices for this month? I paid $300 MORE than last month’s first place winner, and got 4th…Of course, this price rise by bidding early is good for mopar as well, so I doubt this will be implemented instead of the auto-extend thing.

Read full topic

I’m planning on getting a VBulletin and a payed domain though.

item.title: More organized gold status
item.dc:creator: @avirunes avirunes
item.description:
@avirunes wrote:

Well for auction sites they don’t have the issue of timing, but i guess you could make it auto-extend for only one minute, with a minimum bid increase, ie something like $20, that way the bidding amount will raise very fast, and maybe set a limit on the auto-extend (ie 15mins which if someone bid at the 59th second of every minute, with only 1 bid a minute which would be the very minimum for it to auto-extend, then after 15minutes it would already have increased the price by $300 minimum with it likely to be a lot more if it hasn’t finished. (This way it won’t go on forever but people new to the server bidding process will understand the amount involved as they will see it increase rather than a last second snipe from 5-10 servers). At the moment it is virtually impossible* to win a slot if you are new to the process and are unaware that in the last second the 10th slot place may very well double its price. (*virtually impossible to win the slot you want, ie if someone is targetting position 10 it is virtually impossible, but if they are aiming for 1 then they obviously would still be likely to make the top 10 if they place a high bid.

Read full topic

item.title: More organized gold status
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I understand what you mean now, but is there a limit to the number of 'auto-extend’s that there are? It just seems like the bidding might go on for hours past the expiration date if it keeps getting extended.

Read full topic

item.title: More organized gold status
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

That actually sounds like an idea worth implementing mitb. It would add more fairness as well as more cash inflow from the lower spots on the list.

Read full topic

item.title: More organized gold status
item.dc:creator: @avirunes avirunes
item.description:
@avirunes wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I don’t know what you mean by ‘auto-extend’, every bidding website I have seen (ebay for instance) has the bids end at a set time, and it is basically luck mixed with some skill and mostly $ that gets you the win.

Sorry, i’m from new zealand so we use a website called trademe.co.nz over here which is based off ebay so i presumed ebay was the same. Basically auto-extend is when the auction is auto-extended by say 2minutes if a bid is placed with less than 2 minutes to go. This removes the luck element and allows bidders to keep bidding without being snaked at the last second.

The thing i found is that bidding went from $150 to $300 (to qualify for sponsorship) within the last 5minutes, and that 9 and 10 (from memory could of been 8 and 10 etc) 11,12,13 all bid within the last minute and 3 of those 5 bid with 1 second to go basically making it a lucky draw. Even anticipating the last second bidding, you still have to guess how much to bid with 1 second to go as It can leap quite a huge amount in the final 10seconds as people place their bid. I even rememember noticing that (i think it was 11 and 10) placed the exact same bid, one placed and 11:59:50 roughly and another at 11:59:59. Unless you want to overguess with a bid that might just sneak you in or a bid that will set you back an extra $100 than you needed it seems to be very much luck. Just my first thoughts after experiencing it first hand. (sorry if i confused you in their, its late over here)

Read full topic

item.title: More organized gold status
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don’t know what you mean by ‘auto-extend’, every bidding website I have seen (ebay for instance) has the bids end at a set time, and it is basically luck mixed with some skill and mostly $ that gets you the win.

Read full topic

item.title: More organized gold status
item.dc:creator: @avirunes avirunes
item.description:
@avirunes wrote:

The one thing i dislike about the sponsorship bid is that it ends at an exact time with no auto extend with a new bid. This means if you want to sneak in to the top ten you have to be very lucky or place a high bid. The month before this one i remember placing a bid which placed me 7th with 20seconds of bidding to go, i ended up at 12th with 2 people placing a bid with exactly 1 second to go lol. If it had an auto-extend by 1minute where the closing time is switched to 1minute if it is currently less than and someone places a bid then it would make it fairer.

Read full topic
